alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Floyd; Hale; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Floyd, northeastern Hale, southeastern Swisher and southwestern Briscoe Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 557 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of Claytonville, or 11 miles southwest of Silverton, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aiken, South Plains and Claytonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Light accumulations of small hail will be possible. Consider moving to a sturdy shelter until this storm passes. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
